disease: Squamous cell carcinoma of skin of left eyelid, including canthus

symptoms.name: Suspicious skin lesion
symptoms.pattern: Present in sun-exposed skin, may be associated with actinic keratosis

symptoms.name: Painless nodular or plaque-like lesions
symptoms.pattern: May present with irregular rolled edges, chronic scaling, roughened patches, fissuring of the skin, pearly borders, telangiectasia and central ulceration

symptoms.name: Bleeding
symptoms.pattern: May occur if the center of the tumor becomes necrotic

physical_findings: Suspicious skin lesion in sun exposed skin with actinic keratosis, especially in high risk patients
Complete ophthalmic examination, including ocular motility and assessment of proptosis
Assessment of entire face and sun exposed areas, facial sensation
Palpation of regional lymph nodes: preauricular, sublingual, submandibular and cervical

imaging_findings.CT: May show orbital invasion, paranasal sinus involvement, scleral invasion

required: Full thickness biopsy demonstrating full thickness atypia with increased mitotic activity of the squamous cells

differential_diagnoses: Squamous cell carcinoma in situ (Bowen's disease)
Other benign or malignant conditions of the eyelid skin
